payments.heading: Pay to start
payments.note: If I can't fix it, you don't pay.

sla.title: Fast response
items: Same-day delivery for most spreadsheet rescues
Clear scope + fixed price before I start

conversion.intakeHelper: No sales call required. Send scope + deadline and get a confirmed scope boundary before work starts.
conversion.credibilityAnchor: Triage reply within 1 business day · Fixed quote after triage · Written scope boundary · Secure file workflow · NDA available
riskReversal: Clear turnaround window and handoff format
No hidden add-ons or vague deliverables

a.subhead: Reliable fixes for data, automation, and web/app issues.
a.trustLine: Triage reply within 1 business day · Fixed quote after triage · Written scope boundary · Secure file workflow · NDA available

b.headline: Urgent technical work, delivered with clear scope and handoff.

offers.name: Spreadsheet/Data Rescue
offers.summary: Fix formulas, normalize exports, and return analysis-ready files fast.
offers.scopeBoundary: Best for targeted rescue tasks, not full BI platform migrations.

offers.name: Automation
offers.summary: Replace recurring manual work with repeatable scripts, checks, and run notes.
offers.scopeBoundary: Best for repeatable workflows, not enterprise orchestration redesigns.

offers.name: Web/App Fast Lane
offers.summary: Stabilize urgent Django/FastAPI bugs and deploy paths when deadlines are tight.
offers.scopeBoundary: Best for urgent fixes, not full product rewrites.

packages.name: Rescue Sprint
packages.bestFor: Spreadsheet cleanup, formula fixes, and urgent report recovery.

packages.name: Automation Build
packages.bestFor: Replacing repetitive ops with scripts and clear runbooks.

process.title: Send
process.description: You submit scope, context files, and exact deadline.

process.title: Plan
process.description: You receive written scope boundary, deliverables list, and delivery window.

process.title: Deliver
process.description: You receive the fix bundle, QC summary, and handoff run notes.

proof.title: Spreadsheet recovery
proof.before: Inconsistent formats, broken formulas, and manual monthly totals.
proof.after: Normalized structure, validated formulas, and a clean reporting tab.
proof.deliveryNote: Validation checks, assumptions, and next-run instructions.

proof.title: Deploy incident fix
proof.before: Django app failing after dependency drift and env mismatch.
proof.after: Pinned dependencies, corrected config, and green health checks.
proof.deliveryNote: Patch summary, rollback path, and post-deploy checklist.

deliveryBundle.title: Delivery bundle preview

metrics.note: Status tags reflect QC review checks.

qcChecklist: Formula dependency audit and reference stability
Date/time normalization and timezone sanity checks
Output shape validation against requested format

sampleDelivery.title: Sample delivery package (synthetic)
sampleDelivery.scenario: Client had a broken monthly operations workbook and needed a reliable report before Monday 9:00 AM ET.
before: Mixed date formats and duplicate rows across exports
Broken nested formulas in KPI tabs
after: Normalized import sheet with validation checks
Rebuilt formulas with clear named ranges
One-click script for recurring weekly updates
changeLog: Replaced volatile formulas with stable references
Added duplicate detection and date normalization

privacy.note: Public website uses brand identity only. Personal identity is kept off-site except where legally required.
privacy.metadataHygiene: Deliverables follow metadata hygiene to reduce accidental author-information leaks.

faq.question: What files should I send first?
faq.answer: Start with one representative file, expected output, and a short summary of what is broken.

faq.question: How fast can you start?
faq.answer: Most requests are triaged the same day, with clear turnaround windows before work begins.

faq.question: Do you sign NDAs?
faq.answer: Yes, NDA review can be included in intake before any execution work starts.

faq.question: How should I share sensitive files?
faq.answer: Use restricted share links and minimum permissions. See the file-sharing guide for exact steps.
